Uses of Interface
javaslang.algebra.CheckedMonad

  • Packages that use CheckedMonad 
    Package Description
    javaslang.algebra
    Algebraic interfaces used to describe inherent class properties like Monad.
    javaslang.control
    Control structures like the disjoint union type Either, the optional value type Option and Try for exception handling.

    • Uses of CheckedMonad in javaslang.algebra

      Methods in javaslang.algebra that return CheckedMonad 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <U,MONAD extends HigherKinded<U,M>>
      CheckedMonad<U,M>      		 CheckedMonad.flatMap(Try.CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends MONAD> f)
      Returns the result of applying f to M's value of type T and returns a new M with value of type U.
      <U> CheckedMonad<U,M> CheckedMonad.flatten()
      Flattens a nested, monadic structure.
      <U,MONAD extends HigherKinded<U,M>>
      CheckedMonad<U,M>      		 CheckedMonad.flatten(Try.CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends MONAD> f)
      Flattens a nested, monadic structure using a function.
      <U> CheckedMonad<U,M> CheckedMonad.map(Try.CheckedFunction<? super T,? extends U> f) 
      CheckedMonad<T,M> CheckedMonad.peek(Try.CheckedConsumer<? super T> action)
      Performs an action on each element of this monad.

    • Uses of CheckedMonad in javaslang.control

      Subinterfaces of CheckedMonad in javaslang.control 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  Try<T>
      An implementation similar to Scala's Try control.
      Classes in javaslang.control that implement CheckedMonad 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Failure<T>
      A failed Try.
      class  Success<T>
      A succeeded Try.
